getAllKYCData().details: Returns list of all investors data

getInvestors(uint256,uint256).details: Returns list of investors in a range

getKYCData(address[]).details: Returns list of specified investors data

params._additionalBalance: It is the `_value` that transfer during transfer/transferFrom function call
params._tokenHolder: Whom token amount need to query

modifyInvestorFlag(address,uint8,bool).details: Flags are properties about investors that can be true or false like isAccredited

params._flag: index of flag to change. flag is used to know specifics about investor like isAccredited.
params._investor: is the address of the investor.
params._value: value of the flag. a flag can be true or false.

params._flag: index of flag to change. flag is used to know specifics about investor like isAccredited.
params._investors: List of the addresses to modify data about.
params._value: value of the flag. a flag can be true or false.

params._canReceiveAfter: is the moment when the purchase lockup period ends and the investor can freely purchase or receive tokens from others
params._canSendAfter: is the moment when the sale lockup period ends and the investor can freely sell or transfer their tokens
params._expiryTime: is the moment till investors KYC will be validated. After that investor need to do re-KYC

params._canReceiveAfter: is the moment when the purchase lockup period ends and the investor can freely purchase tokens from others
params._canSendAfter: is the moment when the sale lockup period ends and the investor can freely sell his tokens
params._expiryTime: is the moment till investors KYC will be validated. After that investor need to do re-KYC

params._canReceiveAfter: is the moment when the purchase lockup period ends and the investor can freely purchase tokens from others
params._canSendAfter: is the moment when the sale lockup period ends and the investor can freely sell his tokens
params._expiryTime: is the moment till investors KYC will be validated. After that investor need to do re-KYC
params._validFrom: is the time that this signature is valid from
params._validTo: is the time that this signature is valid until

modifyKYCDataSignedMulti(address[],uint2.details: using uint256 for some uint256 variables as web3 wasn;t packing and hashing uint64 arrays properly

params._canReceiveAfter: is the moment when the purchase lockup period ends and the investor can freely purchase tokens from others
params._canSendAfter: is the moment when the sale lockup period ends and the investor can freely sell his tokens
params._expiryTime: is the moment till investors KYC will be validated. After that investor need to do re-KYC
params._validFrom: is the time that this signature is valid from
params._validTo: is the time that this signature is valid until

params._fromRestricted: Defines if transfer time restriction is checked for the sender
params._fromValidKYC: Defines if KYC is required for the sender
params._toRestricted: Defines if transfer time restriction is checked for the receiver
params._toValidKYC: Defines if KYC is required for the receiver
params._transferType: Type of transfer (0 = General, 1 = Issuance, 2 = Redemption)

params._fromRestricted: Defines if transfer time restriction is checked for the sender
params._fromValidKYC: Defines if KYC is required for the sender
params._toRestricted: Defines if transfer time restriction is checked for the receiver
params._toValidKYC: Defines if KYC is required for the receiver
params._transferTypes: Types of transfer (0 = General, 1 = Issuance, 2 = Redemption)

reclaimERC20(address).details: We duplicate here due to the overriden owner & onlyOwner

params._tokenContract: The address of the token contract

reclaimETH().details: We duplicate here due to the overriden owner & onlyOwner

devdoc.title: Transfer Manager module for core transfer validation functionality

changeDefaults(uint64,uint64).notice: Used to change the default times used when canSendAfter / canReceiveAfter are zero

changeIssuanceAddress(address).notice: Used to change the Issuance Address

executeTransfer(address,address,uint256,.notice: Default implementation of verifyTransfer used by SecurityToken If the transfer request comes from the STO, it only checks that the investor is in the whitelist If the transfer request comes from a token holder, it checks that: a) Both are on the whitelist b) Seller's sale lockup period is over c) Buyer's purchase lockup is over

getDataStore().notice: used to return the data store address of securityToken

getInitFunction().notice: This function returns the signature of configure function

getPermissions().notice: Return the permissions flag that are associated with general trnasfer manager

getTokensByPartition(bytes32,address,uin.notice: return the amount of tokens for a given user as per the partition

modifyKYCData(address,uint64,uint64,uint.notice: Add or remove KYC info of an investor.

modifyKYCDataMulti(address[],uint64[],ui.notice: Add or remove KYC info of an investor.

modifyKYCDataSigned(address,uint256,uint.notice: Adds or removes addresses from the whitelist - can be called by anyone with a valid signature

modifyKYCDataSignedMulti(address[],uint2.notice: Adds or removes addresses from the whitelist - can be called by anyone with a valid signature

modifyTransferRequirements(uint8,bool,bo.notice: Modifies the successful checks required for a transfer to be deemed valid.

modifyTransferRequirementsMulti(uint8[],.notice: Modifies the successful checks required for transfers.

verifyTransfer(address,address,uint256,b.notice: Default implementation of verifyTransfer used by SecurityToken
